TopicTitle: iVA shake control defined inside internal or partmodule

Articles.Content:
seemed like a fairly basic idea, but i'm not this far into modding yet

basicly i would like to have a value i can attach to internals or a module for parts (with modulemanager) 

strengthShake= 0.0-1.0

then while in IVA mode, it uses this value (either multiplying stock value, or replacing, multiply seems friendly for public sharing)

currently the internal camera shake is either too strong (for large ships) or if i turn it down, too weak for smaller

then theres the lovely case of IVAs for probes, either turn off shake completely or mission control shakes

so if someone wants to make this please?![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

bonus points, detect when on the launchpad, and get current totalTthrust (current not max) value of rocket

so IVAs that mimic a mission control view can shake only during initial liftoff

strengthShakePad = 0.0-1.0

(formula = stockshake \* strengthShakePad \* (totalThrust / 10000))

You can change the ( EngineType = SolidBooster , EngineType = LiquidFuel , EngineType = Electric , EngineType = Turbine , EngineType = Nuclear , EngineType = MonoProp ) if you look on the RAPIER you can is they changed it for what engine is running pretty sure that is where there getting there shake hope it helps.

i dont want to change the engine types

trying to control shake amount dependent on pod used, thus need some kind of module on the pod
